DataElement.preferredName: Multiple Myeloma Disease Stage Diagnosis Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the coded value used to indicate the stage of a bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the stage of a bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001)

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Multiple Myeloma Disease Stage Diagnosis Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the coded value used to indicate the status of the multiple myeloma disease stage at diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: Invasive cancer confined to the original anatomic site of growth without lymph node involvement.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Invasive cancer more extensive than stage I, usually involving local lymph nodes without spread to distant anatomic sites.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
